pros:
-Hanson is changing lives through education and for that, it is a fulfilling journey.
-Great employee engagement.
-Growth in knowledge, developing of skills and career progression. 
-Fantastic people to work with.
-Very supportive manager.
cons: There will be new challenges but success in overcoming these challenges is achieved with a positive attitude.

job_title: Academic Coordinator in New Westminster, BC
pros: Nothing I could think of that is worth mentioning. Gather work experience necessary to help you realize never to work in a toxic environment, I guess?
cons: Authoritarian and tyrannical CEO, harasses employees on a regular basis, treats people like cattle

review_title: Micromanagement. Middle school style administration. Warning messages every day !
pros: Well equipped classes and good use of technology. Helpful staff.
cons:
1- Micromanagement. Seems like a private middle school. Low wages and high demands (too many managers).

2- Get your tests approved from admin staff? I mean why? Either don't hire an incompetent person or if you hire let them do their job. Reviewed/approved by someone not knowing the area is irrelevant.

3- Have raised it a few times why would you ask Professors to rearrange the chairs after the class and make sure students leave the rooms before you leave ensuring they don't beak the stuff etc"... It's just senseless, Professors must not be asked to escort students out as like a security team.

pros: great staff and lots of events
cons: lots of non tech work and pay is low

pros: Very few smart, ambitious individuals while I was working there, but they have also all departed, so not exactly a pro anymore.
cons: I reported directly to Shouyi and soon came to realize this person lucked into his CEO role vs. earning it or even being qualified for it. Hanson operates in an industry that unless you try very hard to blunder, your revenue and cushy margins will remain intact. Meaning, the CEO doesn’t need to do anything which is exactly what he does. He has no vision, strategy, plan, or idea of what he’s doing! This CEO is also highly unqualified in various aspects. He is neither a leader or motivator and with very low EQ. He is lazy in understanding problems or opportunities, focuses and wastes time on low value priorities, very short attention span, cuts off dialogue using his 'CEO card' when not trending in his direction, etc. etc.

pros: Great place to work in college
cons: less hours , discrimination when allocating hours , bosses favourite gets more hrs . Experienced instructor colleges dp not assist .

review_title: Good company to start a career
pros:
- Excellent fellas to work with
- Great work-life balance
- Tons of small perks
- Good culture
cons:
- Egocentric CEO who changes his vision too often
- No student diversity : 80-90% of students are Indians and Chinese 
- The business acts more like an immigration centre then an education institution.
- Really low salary

review_title: It used to be a better workplace
pros: Sense of community; lots of opportunities to grow and learn
cons: Very elitist - your voices never matter if you don't have a manageral title; executives promoting their sugar-coated visions (mostly metaphors) without proper evidence and action plans, never giving proper answers  to questions from employees; almost all administrative staff with heavy workload without proper compensation; a lot of talented people being fired either because they angered the executives or they couldn't provide "results"; promoting "unity" as a form of assimilation, not alignment, while completely ignoring diversity and inclusion

pros: None at the moment. The work culture used to be great. Now it's a sinking ship.
cons: All the good employees have either quit or have been fired everyone left is just waiting to go down with it.

job_title: Senior Recruiter in North York, ON
pros:
Great team 
Good benefits
Good work culture
cons:
Too much pressure at times
Less team members

pros: The co-workers in BC were amazing, but they’ve all left now cause the company is toxic. It’s a pro+con.
cons:
Very high turnover,
CEO fires staff for his amusement,
Hanson is a business that disguises as an education institution, set up to make money off international students,
Poor compensation, bonus and benefits,
Toxic work environment for your mental health…

review_title: Not a good place for hardworking employees
pros:
* Good co-workers
*No micro-managing by most of managers
*Encouraging employees to do their best
* Yearly gift cards, team building activities etc
cons:
* No direction, long-term strategy and everchanging policies and structure 
* No respect for hard working and dedicated employees
* Promoting employees based on CEO preferences
* Every day hire-and-fire culture
* HR and VP's are puppets ,dancing on CEO's tune

pros: Nice location. The local team in New West is great.
cons: High Turnover. Senior management in Ontario are poor quality managers and executives.

review_title: Good Place to work and grow
pros: Supportive team, everyone is encouraged to learn and grow.
cons: The company keeps growing and changing, need to be able to adapt to changes.

pros: Good enviroment, friendly colleagues and
cons: Low wage and sale job pressure

pros: Optimistic; encompassing; openminded; committed; engaging
cons: Needing a narrower focus. it seems like "online delivery" was, is, and will be a hot topic for discussion and strategy. Perhaps a short narrative - setting the stage - for our comments and dialogues on what do we know about online learning, its strengths and weeknesses and have us to speak to it from our experiences.

review_title: Great place to grow and develop your career!
pros: The team is amazing! There is always an outing, activity, or event planned for us to do! Everyone is very friendly and supportive of each other! This is a company where you can really start from the bottom and climb all the way up if you show that you want it and work for it! Very focused on talent development and promoting within!
cons: Yonge and Eglinton location may be a bit tough to find parking and to commute to if you live far away.

review_title: Supportive, welcoming workplace with room for growth!
job_title: Student Services in New Westminster, BC
pros: There is a strong team-oriented atmosphere, with supportive and encouraging management! There is always potential for growth and development, and team members are so pleasant to work with. A healthy work-life balance is encouraged and there is an emphasis on doing work that utilizes your strengths. Overall, a great place to work!
cons: pay is low compared to other schools, but there are many other perks and benefits

review_title: Push papers, get paid and get out. Don't look for growth
pros:
- Good co-workers outside of management
- Decent benefits
cons:
- Low paying
- Lack of company transparency
- Poor leadership from management
- No one asks, listens or cares about what you need as staff
- Low morale
- No feedback or room to grow
- Very high turnover rate of staff

pros:
organized
on time pay
good gatherings 
hourly pay is higher than other places 
for all the gatherings you get paid. 
respectful students
great colleagues
supportive management and HR
cons:
they do not  give you enough classes
you do not get to work there full time if you are a teacher

pros: Great environment and awesome management. I've never worked for a company who invests in their employees personal growth as much as hanson
cons: The only downside is the salary however, working for a private college this is understandable.

job_title: Instructor, College Or University in Vancouver, BC

cons: Some IT issues regarding Zoom online classes

review_title: Have been with Hanson for more than 3 years
job_title: Academic Team in North York, ON
pros: Great place to start your career, people at North York campus are amazing, so friendly! Lots of opportunities to grow!
cons: Nothing in particular. Maybe the building needs to be moved to a more lively area

pros: Wonderful work ethics, great cultural diversity, excellent management, flexible working hours
cons: pay is normal not below industry benchmark.
